alert.note: Alert for Blount; Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:31PM CDT until July 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN BLOUNT AND NORTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 431 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, or 14 miles south of Maryville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Citico Beach, Tariffville, Citico, Talassee and Happy Valley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
